item.title: Report E-2025010428
item.description:
Report E-2025010428

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-04T06:26:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-24
  • City: HUBER HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately a half (.5) gallon of material released from one (1) 330-gallon IBC tote due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the tote being cracked. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010388
item.description:
Report E-2025010388

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-28
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 28, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of methanol was punctured and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. All impacted absorbents were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged drum was placed in one (1) 85-gallon overpack.

item.title: Report E-2025010345
item.description:
Report E-2025010345

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-17
  • City: KENT
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When facility was going to move around trailers to be loaded/unloaded it was noticed that material was dripping out the doors of the trailer around 1230 et. The put down absorbent to contain any runoff and begin absorbing the material. They opened the doors of the trailer to find that a drum had tipped over in transit. They then call for a team to come out and clean up the material that had release. The team arrived at 1445 et to review the information and began creating a plan. 1600 et the needed equipment and proper PPE needed arrived and the work began on the clean up. They uprighted the drum and began cleaning up any material that had released to the trailer and the pavement. The bung were checked and tightened and the absorbents that were used to clean up the material were placed into drums and disposed of properly. The clean up was completed at 2100 et.
